marketNews.title: Government Officially Changes Minerba Royalty Rates
marketNews.content:
The Government officially increased royalty rates for several mineral commodities - such as nickel, copper, and gold - through Government Regulation No. 19/2025. Additionally, the government also adjusted royalties for coal commodity producers operating under a Special Mining Business Permit (IUPK) through Government Regulation No. 18/2025.

Both regulations are relatively similar to the proposals submitted by the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources (ESDM) in early March 2025 - which we previously summarized in the Stockbit Commentary - where the majority of mineral commodities experienced royalty rate increases, while coal producers with IUPK permits experienced a decrease in rates.

However, the final increase in royalty rates for ferronickel and nickel matte commodities is lower than the previous proposal. Previously, the ESDM Ministry proposed that the royalty rate for ferronickel be in the range of 5-7% and for nickel matte be in the range of 4.5-6.5%. In the final regulation, the royalty rate for ferronickel ranges from 4-6%, while nickel matte is around 3.5-5.5%.

Meanwhile, there is no information yet regarding the royalty tax for coal issuers operating under a Coal Mining Concession Agreement (PKP2B) permit and IUP.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway: Impact of Royalty Rate Changes
marketNews.content:
We assess that these royalty rate changes have the potential to pressure the performance of mineral producing issuers, such as Vale Indonesia ($INCO), Trimegah Bangun Persada ($NCKL), Aneka Tambang ($ANTM), Bumi Resources Minerals ($BRMS), and Amman Mineral Internasional ($AMMN). On the other hand, these royalty rate changes have the potential to boost the performance of coal producers with IUPK contracts - such as Adaro Andalan Indonesia ($AADI), Bumi Resources ($BUMI), and Indika Energy ($INDY). For illustration, the Reference Coal Price (HBA) in March 2025 was at the level of 128 US dollars per ton, so the royalty rate for these three issuers could potentially drop from 28% to 19%.

In a previous Stockbit Commentary, we attempted to calculate the potential impact of these royalty rate changes on the net profit of AADI, BUMI, and INDY. Based on our analysis, BUMI is the issuer that benefits the most with a potential net profit increase in 2025 of +142% YoY, followed by INDY (+126% YoY), and AADI (+21.9% YoY), based on the main assumption of the average Newcastle coal price at the level of 110 US dollars per ton.

marketNews.title: Correction on Mitsubishi Sales Data from Tuesday (15/4)
marketNews.content: On Tuesday (15/4), Stockbit Snips reported in the table that Mitsubishi recorded sales of 5,769 units (-32% YoY, -34% MoM) in March 2025 and 21,692 units (-16% YoY) during 3M25. This information was incorrect because it did not account for Mitsubishi Fuso sales. The correct information is that Mitsubishi (Motors+Fuso) sales were 7,373 units (-13% YoY, -16% MoM) in March 2025, resulting in cumulative sales for 3M25 reaching 23,296 units (-9.4% YoY). This error has been corrected on the Stockbit Snips website page.

marketNews.title: Other hot topics you need to know...
marketNews.content:
1. US President, Donald Trump, again asked the Chinese government to start negotiations to resolve the escalation of the trade war. In response, the spokesperson for the Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Lin Jian, stated that if the US truly wants to resolve the issue through dialogue and negotiation, the US must stop using maximum pressure and cease threats and blackmail.
2. China's national statistics bureau recorded that China's economic growth reached +5.4% YoY in 1Q25 (vs. 4Q24: +5.4% YoY), exceeding consensus expectations at +5.1% YoY and remaining the strongest annual growth since 3Q23. Meanwhile, the unemployment rate in March 2025 fell to 5.2% (vs. Feb 2025: 5.4%), better than the consensus expectation of 5.3%. In other data, retail sales in China grew +5.9% YoY in March 2025 (vs. 2M25: +4% YoY), exceeding consensus expectations of +4.2% YoY.
3. Bank Indonesia estimates that Indonesian retail sales will grow +0.5% YoY and +8.3% MoM in March 2025. Meanwhile, the realization of retail sales in February 2025 was recorded at +2% YoY and +3.3% MoM (vs. Jan 2024: +0.5% YoY, -4.7% MoM), exceeding Bank Indonesia's forecast of -0.5% YoY and +0.8% MoM.
4. Bank Indonesia noted that the Indonesian Consumer Confidence Index in March 2025 dropped to 121.1 (vs. Feb 2025: 126.4), marking a decline for 3 consecutive months although still in an optimistic range. This result was driven down by a decrease across all sub-indices.
5. Minister of ESDM, Bahlil Lahadalia, stated on Tuesday (15/4) that the Indonesian government proposes increasing oil and LPG imports from the US by around 10 billion US dollars as part of a negotiation proposal to avoid a 32% tariff from the US. During 2024, the US contributed about 57% of Indonesia's total LPG imports, which reached 217,000 barrels of LPG per day, and supplied about 4.2% of Indonesia's total oil imports, which reached 306,000 barrels per day.
6. Japfa Ltd. (SGX: UD2) shareholders on Tuesday (15/4) approved the plan to go private, with an estimated delisting date from the Singapore exchange falling on June 3, 2025. Japfa Ltd. is the controller of Japfa Comfeed Indonesia ($JPFA).
7. Ecocare Indo Pasifik ($HYGN) plans to conduct a share buyback with an allocation fund of up to 5 billion rupiah from April 15 to July 15, 2025, although the company did not specify the maximum number of shares to be purchased. This plan does not require shareholder approval (RUPS), following relaxation provided by the OJK to support capital market stability.
8. The controller of Hillcon ($HILL), PT Hillcon Equity Management, sold 10 million HILL shares at a price of 320 rupiah per share on April 11, 2025. The total transaction value reached 3.2 billion rupiah. After this transaction, the ownership of PT Hillcon Equity Management in HILL decreased from 57.54% to 57.47%.

marketNews.title: Correction on TPIA Capital Injection Data from Tuesday (15/4)
marketNews.content: On Tuesday (15/4), Stockbit Snips reported that the total capital injection made by Chandra Asri Pacific ($TPIA) and Phoenix Power B.V. to PT Chandra Daya Investasi Tbk was 1.75 trillion rupiah, consisting of 850 billion rupiah from TPIA and 900 billion rupiah from Phoenix Power B.V. This information was incorrect. The correct information is that TPIA and Phoenix Power B.V. injected capital amounting to 185 million US dollars or approximately 2.96 trillion rupiah into PT Chandra Daya Investasi Tbk, consisting of 90 million US dollars or approximately 1.44 trillion rupiah from TPIA and 95 million US dollars or approximately 1.52 trillion rupiah from Phoenix Power B.V. This error has been corrected on the Stockbit Snips website page.

tickerNews.title: AADI Plans Share Buyback Up to IDR 4 Trillion
tickerNews.content: Adaro Andalan Indonesia plans to conduct a share buyback with a fund allocation of up to 4 trillion rupiah within a period of 12 months starting from May 23, 2025, although the company did not specify the maximum number of shares to be purchased. This plan will be discussed at the Annual General Meeting of Shareholders (RUPS) on May 22, 2025.

tickerNews.title: ASII Car Wholesales Decline in March 2025 and 1Q25
tickerNews.content: Astra International recorded car wholesales of 37,735 units in March 2025 (-6.5% YoY, -2.1% MoM), worse than the industry realization (-5.1% YoY, -2% MoM), causing ASII's market share to drop to 53.2% in March 2025 (vs. Mar 2024: 54%, Feb 2025: 53.3%). ASII's car wholesales in March 2025 were supported by Toyota+Lexus sales of 22,658 units (+5.8% YoY, -7.5% MoM), while Daihatsu sales decreased year-on-year to 13,057 units (-21% YoY, +9.2% MoM). Cumulatively, ASII's car wholesales during 1Q25 fell to 110,812 units (-7.3% YoY), with market share decreasing to 54% (vs. 1Q24: 55.6%, 2M25: 54.4%).

tickerNews.title: BREN Secures Credit Facility for Wayang Windu Expansion
tickerNews.content: Barito Renewables Energy signed a credit facility agreement of up to 139.5 million US dollars from SMBC and DBS Bank Ltd. This facility is intended to finance the expansion of the Wayang Windu project through the retrofit of PLTP unit 1 and unit 2 with an additional capacity of 18.4 MW and the construction of PLTP unit 3 of 30 MW.

tickerNews.title: INTP Cement Sales Volume Drops in March 2025, Market Share Rises
tickerNews.content: Indocement Tunggal Prakarsa recorded a decrease in cement sales volume of -17% YoY in March 2025, but its market share increased to 30.7% (vs. Feb 2025: 28.6%, Mar 2024: 28.8%) along with a deeper decline in industry-wide sales volume (-22% YoY). This result caused INTP's sales volume for 1Q25 to fall -5.9% YoY, better than the industry which fell -7.8% YoY. The decline in sales volume in March 2025 was primarily due to fewer working days due to the shift in the Eid al-Fitr holiday. By segmentation, bagged cement sales and bulk cement sales decreased by -13% YoY and -25% YoY respectively in March 2025.

tickerNews.title: SMGR Announces Buyback Plan and Expansion of Business Activities
tickerNews.content: Semen Indonesia announced that the share buyback plan with a fund allocation of up to 300 billion rupiah will take place from May 24, 2025, to May 23, 2026, although the company did not specify the maximum number of shares to be purchased. SMGR also plans to add business activities in the self-owned or leased real estate sector, wholesale trade of roof tiles, bricks, tiles, and similar items, as well as the industry of goods from cement and lime for construction. Both plans will be discussed at the RUPS on May 23, 2025.

tickerNews.title: Patrick Rudolf Dannacher Increases Stake in CYBR
tickerNews.content: The controller and President Commissioner of ITSEC Asia, Patrick Rudolf Dannacher, purchased approximately 16 million CYBR shares at an average price of 725 rupiah per share between March 18 and April 14, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 11.6 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, Patrick Rudolf Dannacher's ownership in CYBR increased from 0.462% to 0.698%.

tickerNews.title: Advance Opportunities Fund Reduces Stake in NINE
tickerNews.content: The shareholder of Techno9 Indonesia, Advance Opportunities Fund, sold approximately 33.5 million NINE shares at an average price of 139 rupiah per share on April 14-15, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 4.7 billion rupiah. After the transaction, the ownership of Advance Opportunities Fund in NINE decreased from 16.35% to 14.79%.

tickerNews.title: Christopher Sumasto Tjia Increases Direct Ownership in NICL
tickerNews.content: The controller of PAM Mineral, Christopher Sumasto Tjia, purchased approximately 11.4 million NICL shares at an average price of 336 rupiah per share between April 10 and 15, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 3.8 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, Christopher Sumasto Tjia's direct ownership in NICL increased from 0.039% to 0.147%.

tickerNews.title: KLIN Controller Plans Mandatory Tender Offer
tickerNews.content: PT Samico Capital Utama Mulia, as the new controller of Klinko Karya Imaji, plans to conduct a mandatory tender offer for up to 267.5 million (20.46%) KLIN shares from April 17 to May 16, 2025. The tender offer price is 169 rupiah per share, resulting in a potential transaction value of 45.2 billion rupiah. Previously, PT Samico Capital Utama Mulia had acquired 60% of the company's shares at a price of 31 rupiah per share in February 2025.
